job_title: Health Data Analyst (RA3) Limited Duration/Job Rotation
job_text: ['', 'Complete the online application', ' Demonstrated ability to write scripts/macros in software that automates the process of extracting and compiling data from Excel or flat files. ', "Please monitor your Workday account, as all communication will be sent to your Workday account. You must have a valid e-mail address to apply.If you are a veteran, you may receive preference. Click here for more information about veterans’ preference. If you checked that you are a veteran, we will ask you for your documents later in the process.We do not offer VISA sponsorships or transfers at this time – unless specifically noted. Within three days of hire, you will be required to complete the US Department of Homeland Security's I-9 form confirming authorization to work in the United States.If you are offered employment, the offer will be contingent upon the outcome of an abuse check, criminal records check and driving records check, and the information shall be shared with the Oregon Health Authority (OHA), Office of Human Resources (OHR). Any criminal or founded abuse history will be reviewed and could result in the withdrawal of the offer or termination of employment.Please only attach documents that are related to the position. Additional documents that are attached will not be reviewed. Applicant Help and Support webpage", 'Complete the online applicationComplete Questionnaire Upload Resume (required)  Upload Cover Letter (required) ', 'Position Type', 'Please only attach documents that are related to the position. Additional documents that are attached will not be reviewed.', 'What you will do!', "What's in it for you?", ' with paid sick leave, vacation, personal leave and ten paid holidays per year plus ', ' Demonstrated ability to coordinate multiple competing priorities. ', ' The ability to apply methods and procedures of technical report writing to communicate effectively verbally and in writing. ', 'If You Need Assistance To Participate In The Application Process, Including An Accommodation Request Under The American With Disabilities Act, Please Contact', ". If you're driven by the passion to do something meaningful that changes lives, the ", " Are you skilled in working with databases and surveys. Are you knowledgeable about health policy and the healthcare workforce. Can you perform statistical and quantitative analyses and effectively present data using text, charts, graphs, and other data.What you will do!You will collaborate with other analysts to manage the development and implementation of Oregon’s Health Care Workforce database (“workforce”) as well as analyze these databases and secondary datasets such as the American Community Survey. You will implement and analyze data from surveys, which could include the Oregon Health Information Survey (OHIS) and other surveys as needed, and will establish and refine procedures to assure the quality of data and validity of results.What's in it for you?We offer a workplace that balances productivity with enjoyment; promote an atmosphere of mutual respect, dedication, and enthusiasm. You will collaborate in an open office with a team of bright individuals to work with and learn from. We offer full  medical, vision and dental  with paid sick leave, vacation, personal leave and ten paid holidays per year plus  pension and retirement plans . If you're driven by the passion to do something meaningful that changes lives, the  Oregon Health Authority is the place for you.This is a full-time, limited duration position (not to exceed 24 months) that is classified and represented by SEIU. Current State of Oregon employees may have an additional option as a job rotation.The Oregon Health Authority is committed to developing and promoting culturally and linguistically appropriate programs and a diverse and inclusive workforce representing the diversity, culture, strengths and values of the people of Oregon. Click here to learn more about OHA’s mission, vision and core values.OHA is an affirmative action and equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, age, protected veteran or disabled status, genetic information or any other protected class under state or federal law.What We Are Looking ForA Bachelor's Degree in any discipline that included six-quarter units in statistics or quantitative analysis methods and procedures, and one year experience using computerized applications to independently gather, compile, and analyze data and prepare narrative or statistical reports; OR Four years of research experience using computerized applications to independently gather, compile, and analyze data and prepare narrative or statistical reports. A Master's degree in biostatistics, public health, public administration, finance, social sciences, accounting, demography, or related field is preferred.  Extensive knowledge of research design, methods and advanced analytical research techniques.  The ability to apply methods and procedures of technical report writing to communicate effectively verbally and in writing.  Extensive knowledge of computer concepts, applications and capabilities including systems design, programming languages such as SQL, and statistical or quantitative analysis software packages such as R or SAS.  Demonstrated ability to write scripts/macros in software that automates the process of extracting and compiling data from Excel or flat files.  Knowledge of health services research and evaluation design, methods, and analyses.  Knowledge of issues related to health care finance, delivery, health policy and the healthcare workforce is preferred.  Demonstrated ability to perform statistical and quantitative analyses.  Demonstrated ability to effectively present data using text, charts, graphs, and other data visualizations.  Experience with Tableau or other data visualization software.  Demonstrated ability to establish and maintain professional and collaborative working relationships with all contacts and communicate in a professional and collegial manner.  Demonstrated ability to coordinate multiple competing priorities.  Experience in creating and maintaining a work environment that is respectful and accepting of diversity among team members and the people we serve. How To ApplyComplete the online applicationComplete Questionnaire Upload Resume (required)  Upload Cover Letter (required) Please ensure you’ve provided a thorough and updated application as it pertains to the position for which you are applying. Your application materials will be used to determine salary based on a pay equity assessment. For further information, please visit the Pay Equity Project Homepage.PRE-EMPLOYMENT CHECKSIf you are offered employment, the offer will be contingent upon the outcome of an abuse check, criminal records check and driving records check, and the information shall be shared with the Oregon Health Authority (OHA), Office of Human Resources (OHR). ', "A Bachelor's Degree in any discipline that included six-quarter units in statistics or quantitative analysis methods and procedures, and one year experience using computerized applications to independently gather, compile, and analyze data and prepare narrative or statistical reports; OR Four years of research experience using computerized applications to independently gather, compile, and analyze data and prepare narrative or statistical reports.", "A Bachelor's Degree in any discipline that included six-quarter units in statistics or quantitative analysis methods and procedures, and one year experience using computerized applications to independently gather, compile, and analyze data and prepare narrative or statistical reports; OR Four years of research experience using computerized applications to independently gather, compile, and analyze data and prepare narrative or statistical reports. A Master's degree in biostatistics, public health, public administration, finance, social sciences, accounting, demography, or related field is preferred.  Extensive knowledge of research design, methods and advanced analytical research techniques.  The ability to apply methods and procedures of technical report writing to communicate effectively verbally and in writing.  Extensive knowledge of computer concepts, applications and capabilities including systems design, programming languages such as SQL, and statistical or quantitative analysis software packages such as R or SAS.  Demonstrated ability to write scripts/macros in software that automates the process of extracting and compiling data from Excel or flat files.  Knowledge of health services research and evaluation design, methods, and analyses.  Knowledge of issues related to health care finance, delivery, health policy and the healthcare workforce is preferred.  Demonstrated ability to perform statistical and quantitative analyses.  Demonstrated ability to effectively present data using text, charts, graphs, and other data visualizations.  Experience with Tableau or other data visualization software.  Demonstrated ability to establish and maintain professional and collaborative working relationships with all contacts and communicate in a professional and collegial manner.  Demonstrated ability to coordinate multiple competing priorities.  Experience in creating and maintaining a work environment that is respectful and accepting of diversity among team members and the people we serve. ", 'Complete Questionnaire', 'Additional Information']

to the policy of Equal Employment Opportunity and to carrying out this policy at all of its offices. It shall be the policy of Omnicom Media Group to (1) recruit, select, hire, train, promote, pay, discipline and terminate employees in all job classifications without regard to age, race, color, creed, national origin, citizenship status, alienage, religion, sex, sexual orientation, marital status, veteran status, disability or any other basis upon which discrimination against or harassment of employees or applicants for employment is prohibited under any applicable federal, state or local equal opportunity employment laws and (2) ensure that all personnel actions are administered without discrimination in violation of applicable law.', 'Experience working within the Agile Methodology', 'Join our dynamic and diverse team at Annalect – data solutions for marketers, by marketers.', '5 – 8 years’ experience in Technical Business Analysis, Project Management, Program Management, or similar experience in a Technology function', 'Coding experience, such as with Python or SQL', 'A demonstrated passion for technology, with an ability to engage thoughtfully and articulately with internal and external stakeholders with varying levels of technical expertise', 'Monitor organizational costs and understand expenditures relative to budget, communicating across stakeholders to ensure alignment, particularly with Annalect Finance', 'Strong financial acumen, including experience monitoring costs/budgets in Technology relative to priorities and roadmap', 'Serve as the face of Annalect Technology to internal and external stakeholders', 'Job Description', 'Maintain a deep understanding of Technology’s roadmap, priorities, and ongoing projects, to:', 'Coding experience, such as with Python or SQLExperience working within the Agile MethodologyExperience in Media, Advertising, Marketing or a similar industry', 'As every CMO knows, employing technology, data and analytics to business challenges is the cost of entry, not a nice to have. Unlocking the value of consumer data can deliver growth, revenue and ROI, and create differentiation to stay on top. Real-time action is instrumental in driving results within a highly fragmented marketplace. Annalect’s data solutions are built to deliver insightful results with speed, accuracy and a single version of the truth. In leveraging the DNA of a marketing agency with a talent pool of developers, data scientists and Ph.Ds, we hold a unique position in the increasingly crowded ad tech and consulting space.', 'Experience writing detailed business requirements relative to broad business needs', 'Additional Skills (Nice to have one or more of these):', 'Annalect is looking for a Technical Business Analyst to join our Engineering team to provide program management support for the function. Specifically, this role is accountable for maintaining a deep understanding of our development and engineering roadmap, monitoring costs and our overall budget relative to engineering efforts and projects, and ensuring alignment and communication across technology, finance, and other stakeholders within Annalect. Furthermore, this role will play a part in managing communications with vendors, project management and documentation, and ensuring alignment within our function to help enable our developers to do what they do best: develop. This role will work with product, engineering, and finance as well as external vendors and will be expected to act as the face of our technology function to other internal technology teams, external vendors, and internal stakeholders. ['', 'To be successful in this role, you must', 'Rapidly acquire new skills and work with new technologies.', 'Founded on Four Cornerstones, 8 character traits and a simple operating philosophy of\xa0Serve • Better • Value • Fun.', 'Be a great teammate.', 'Serve • Better • Value • Fun.', 'Minimum requirements:', 'Our culture is characterized as', 'Be able to identify and meet the varied urgency level of others while maintaining a calm, cool demeanor.', 'Servant focused.', 'Our core brands of Camo, Pro-Fit and Stinger are the “asked for brands” in their respective segments. Found at some of the finest names in the LBM, Roofing, Home Center, Distribution and STAFDA channels of the building industry and more recently, through our E-Commerce presence. Our Brand users are the hardworking folks who build things with their hands, and just like us, they are business owners. They build our homes, our decks, install our roofs and they depend on our brands to support them in delivering a job well done.', 'Our company’s reason for existing', 'Analytical problem solving.', 'Aspire to our 8 character traits.Enjoy researching and problem solving.Be an analytical thinker with a high level of enjoyment, comfort, and understanding in working with numbers.Have an ambitious eye for detail and knack for data visualization.Be curious and willing to “roll up your sleeves” within your team, and at times, balance multiple projects.Possess the ability to translate business questions into data-related questions and effectively articulate data-driven answers.Be able to identify and meet the varied urgency level of others while maintaining a calm, cool demeanor.Rapidly acquire new skills and work with new technologies.', 'Your Assignment', 'We are an employee-owned company and have been a proud part of the American building materials industry for nearly 60 years. We have a storied history of innovation, which many say is in our DNA. We agree. From product to brand, to sourcing to customer-centric solutions, we constantly ask the “what, why and how” questions that many are afraid to ask.', 'Whether supporting our customers, suppliers, employee-owners and their families or the communities in which we live and work, our purpose is simple; inspire whoever we engage with to help them become better. Better people, families, businesses, and ultimately leave better the communities in which we live in. We get this is a moonshot reason for existing. Yet it is one we are committed to.', 'Strong relationship building abilities and a trust builder.', 'Servant focused.Founded on Four Cornerstones, 8 character traits and a simple operating philosophy of\xa0Serve • Better • Value • Fun.High standard, embraced by a dedicated team of employee-owners who enjoy the fruits of hard work while having a “bit of fun” along the way.Growth-minded, driving the intentional investments in developing our people, our customers and our communities.Innovative.', 'Have an ambitious eye for detail and knack for data visualization.', '1-5 years of market research, market intelligence, analyst, or relevant consulting/internship experience.Experience with Microsoft Office Suite, Google Suite, CRMs, Business Intelligence tools.Analytical problem solving.Strong relationship building abilities and a trust builder.Value both the opportunity to do well professionally and grow personally.Be a great teammate.', 'Imagine when', 'Possess the ability to translate business questions into data-related questions and effectively articulate data-driven answers.', 'Value both the opportunity to do well professionally and grow personally.', 'Aspire to our 8 character traits.', 'Experience with Microsoft Office Suite, Google Suite, CRMs, Business Intelligence tools.', 'Growth-minded, driving the intentional investments in developing our people, our customers and our communities.', 'About us', 'So, if this is an assignment, culture, and an industry you desire to explore further, contact us. Your new adventure awaits.', 'High standard, embraced by a dedicated team of employee-owners who enjoy the fruits of hard work while having a “bit of fun” along the way.', 'Enjoy researching and problem solving.', 'You will be a member of our sales operations and business analytics teams. Your first assignment will find you as a key team member implementing our Sales Force CRM platform. You will be responsible for capturing, synthesizing and building out our customer, brand and market share data for North America. Your work product will be used to drive both strategic investments and the tactical direction for our teams. Market research and analytics will be a passion of yours as you learn the ins and outs driving our market opportunities. You will regularly collaborate on cross-departmental ad hoc projects, focused on a variety of areas while having exposure to our Executive Leadership Team.', '1-5 years of market research, market intelligence, analyst, or relevant consulting/internship experience.', 'You have the opportunity to be a team member on our growth-minded, industry leading, innovative, brand-driven, global employee-owned company. You are challenged to grow while challenging others, find great enjoyment in what you do and are a significant part of something much bigger than you. You leave an indelible legacy mark on our company through the people your life impacts. And all the while, and most importantly, you find yourself growing as a person.', 'Be an analytical thinker with a high level of enjoyment, comfort, and understanding in working with numbers.', 'Be curious and willing to “roll up your sleeves” within your team, and at times, balance multiple projects.', 'Innovative.']

company: New York State Technology Enterprise Corporation (NYSTEC)
job_text: ['', 'Education and Experience', 'About the Role:', 'At least six years of experience as a full-time business analyst', 'Knowledge of, and experience with, development and Systems Development Lifecycle (SDLC) methods such as Waterfall, RUP, Agile, Scrum, etc.', 'If you’re an effective communicator who enjoys working in complex and collaborative environments, utilizing your critical thinking and research skills to develop solutions for clients, providing support to customers, and have the required education, experience and skills, we want to hear from you.', 'Preferred/Desired Qualifications', 'Preference for candidates with knowledge and experience of NYS and/or NYC government.', 'Key Responsibilities', 'Proactively provide status of all project activities to management including progress, issues, risks, mitigations, resolutions, successes and lessons learned', "It is NYSTEC's policy to provide equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all individuals, regardless of actual or perceived race, color, creed, religion, sex or gender (including pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions), gender identity or gender expression (including transgender status), age, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, protected medical condition as defined by applicable state or local law, genetic information, military service and veteran status, sexual orientation, marital status, , or any other characteristic protected by local, state, or federal law and ordinances. NYSTEC is strongly committed to this policy and believes in the concept and spirit of the law.", 'Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States without the need for visa sponsorship now or in the future.', 'Serving as a Business Analyst, your day-to-day role as a NYSTEC consultant will include\xa0supporting the team in defining functional, non-functional and technical requirements and specifications to support the client’s business needs; creating, reviewing, and maintaining artifacts and appropriate documentation; and working with a team to ensure that all necessary requirements are complete, organized, and prioritized.', 'Experience supporting requirements analysis, design, testing, and implementation activities.', 'Required Qualifications', 'Conduct requirements gathering, validation, and rationalization processes', 'Liaise with relevant stakeholders, including subject matter experts, executive teams, managers, program directors, and end-users to ensure that projects meet business needs', 'Demonstrated knowledge of in-scope Health and Human Services programs.', 'Evaluate project timelines and priorities and provide inputs to the NYSTEC project team timelines', '\ufeff', 'Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to interact with diverse stakeholder groups, executives, managers, subject matter experts, technical staff, consultants/contractors and end users', 'Analyze as-is business processes and systems to establish to-be workflows and designs;', 'A minimum of a master’s degree with at least six years of related experience in a related field of study is required. An equivalent combination of advanced education, training, and experience will be considered.', 'Proficiency with Microsoft Office applications, including exposure to MS Project and Visio.', 'As a Business Analyst, you will collaborate with team members to conceptualize, deliver, and support our clients through today’s ever-changing landscape. NYSTEC is considered a trusted advisor, partner of choice and employer of choice. job_title: Healthcare Analytics Business Analyst - Murray, Utah or Remote
job_text: ['', 'Qualifications', ' Exceptional presentation and communication skills, both verbal and written.', ' Create and deliver custom reports/dashboards and handle special projects as needed.', ' Gain access to necessary data though SQL queries, excel extracts, and various tools.', ' Highly organized, detail-oriented, and excellent internal and external customer service skills.', ' Requires strong interpersonal skills with the ability to work with both management and other employees; exercise good judgement in choosing appropriate communication channels.', ' Interpret the data to provide meaningful answers or recommendations.', ' Prefer experience with QlikView, Qlik Sense, Power BI and other BI tools.', ' Validate data is queried and reported in a manner that drives efficiency and reduces errors.', " Professional experience in 340B, pharmacy, healthcare, or related. Bachelor's Degree in Healthcare Administration, Research/Statistics or related field required or a Master's Degree in Business Intelligence. A combination of education and experience may meet requirements. Experience developing analyses using SQL or SAS required. Experience working with and manipulating large sets of data. Excellent analytical, organizational, and data driven skills required. Proficient with data mining, interpretation, and explanation. Ability to juggle multiple projects and shifting priorities. Ability to organize and prioritize multiple projects, determine the best course of action, identify resources needed to complete a project, obtain valid data, and create clear and understandable reports that answer the questions being asked or solve the problems at hand. Highly organized, detail-oriented, and excellent internal and external customer service skills. Exceptional presentation and communication skills, both verbal and written. Requires strong interpersonal skills with the ability to work with both management and other employees; exercise good judgement in choosing appropriate communication channels. Proven track record as a team player with strong business ethics. Proficient use of MS Excel, Access, Word, PowerPoint and SQL. Prefer experience with QlikView, Qlik Sense, Power BI and other BI tools.", ' Professional experience in 340B, pharmacy, healthcare, or related.', " Gather and analyze business requirements and goals from various stakeholders. Gain access to necessary data though SQL queries, excel extracts, and various tools. Interpret the data to provide meaningful answers or recommendations. Identify patterns and trends in the data; ability to forecast; ability to tell the data's story. Create and deliver custom reports/dashboards and handle special projects as needed. Perform advanced analytical activities, including defining, measuring, and communicating core operational metrics and providing insight to the business. Perform both routine and ad hoc reports and analyses. Validate data is queried and reported in a manner that drives efficiency and reduces errors. Schedule project timelines and coordinate projects through initial idea to completion. May coordinate and prioritize the work of others. Perform other duties as assigned.", ' Schedule project timelines and coordinate projects through initial idea to completion.', ' Perform both routine and ad hoc reports and analyses.', ' Ability to juggle multiple projects and shifting priorities.', ' Experience developing analyses using SQL or SAS required.', ' May coordinate and prioritize the work of others.', ' Ability to organize and prioritize multiple projects, determine the best course of action, identify resources needed to complete a project, obtain valid data, and create clear and understandable reports that answer the questions being asked or solve the problems at hand.', ' Perform other duties as assigned.', ' Gather and analyze business requirements and goals from various stakeholders.', ' Proficient with data mining, interpretation, and explanation.', ' Experience working with and manipulating large sets of data.', ' Excellent analytical, organizational, and data driven skills required.', " Bachelor's Degree in Healthcare Administration, Research/Statistics or related field required or a Master's Degree in Business Intelligence.", ' Proficient use of MS Excel, Access, Word, PowerPoint and SQL.', 'Responsibilities', ' Proven track record as a team player with strong business ethics.', " Identify patterns and trends in the data; ability to forecast; ability to tell the data's story.", ' Perform advanced analytical activities, including defining, measuring, and communicating core operational metrics and providing insight to the business.', ' A combination of education and experience may meet requirements.']

['', '3) Attitude', 'This role is for a BA in the Cyber Security PMO, The BA will analyze business technology needs for Lines of Business and the Cyber security organization. The successful candidate will work as a strategic partner and business liaison who understands business drivers and desired outcomes and will drive their transformation into well-aligned processes, procedures, and systems. They will assemble, analyze, and translate business requirements into detailed requirements, business process designs and use cases. Additionally, they will perform feasibility analysis; will collaborate with Project Managers to develop project scope, project strategy and deliverable prioritization; will collaborate with Solution and Domain Architects to provide recommendations on alternative solutions.', '2) Skills required to do the job', 'TOP 3 TECH SKILLS:', 'Qualifications:', 'Business Analyst : Contract Position Summary This role will analyze business technology needs for Lines of Business and the Cyber Security organization. The\u202fsuccessful candidate will work as a strategic partner and business liaison who understands business drivers and desired outcomes and will drive their transformation into well-aligned processes, procedures, and systems. They will assemble, analyze, and translate business requirements into detailed requirements, business process designs and use cases. Additionally, they will perform feasibility analysis; will collaborate with Project Managers to develop project scope, project strategy and deliverable prioritization; will collaborate with Solution and Domain Architects to provide recommendations on alternative solutions. Desired: CCBA-certification of Competency in Business Analysis Experience serving and meeting the needs of internal and/or external customers IT Background (especially cybersecurity and infrastructure components) Direct participation in a diverse collection of high complexity projects related to IT security Utilities background in energy sector Knowledge Skills and Abilities: Demonstrated experience of and knowledge in a broad range of IT and cybersecurity areas (e.g. applications, infrastructure, processes). Systems thinking approach to problem solving. Strong visualization skills. Capability to have birds-eye view (i.e. 100k foot view) of a problem as well as be detail-oriented. Must demonstrate excellent communication skills at all levels, written, verbal, visual, and interpersonal. Ability to analyze requirements and proposed solutions independently with limited guidance. Ability to lead medium to high complexity level requirements efforts and coaching or mentor less experienced business analysts. Ability to perform peer review of requirements, process designs, use cases, and related project documentation. Ability to work effectively with other groups to persuade, exchange ideas and foster cooperation. Demonstrated familiarity with the following areas: testing, project management, related Lines of Business, software development, NERC regulatory compliance, SOX compliance, operational/disaster recovery, operations, maintenance, etc. Demonstrated seasoned experienced-based judgment in applying and adapting techniques with high credibility of the project team members. Job Responsibilities Reduce complex problems to easily understood narratives and informational materials (drawings, infographics, presentations, etc.) Evaluate and document alternatives that will provide the most effective solutions to business problems. Define and document business requirements for moderate-to-complex projects. Identify, propose and influence IT solutions to moderate-to-complex business problems; negotiate requirements and deliverables with the client. Perform user-acceptance and application testing. Participate in project scoping and estimation. Anticipate client concerns and questions. Provide timely and professional client-focused communications. Prepare or review test plans and perform quality reviews of test results. Provide consulting in information security technology alignment to the client to identify and satisfy the business needs. Review designs and technical specification documents for alignment with business solution. Understand the client’s current and future business environment, effectively anticipate, identify and meet the business needs. Actively contribute to the business cases for Cybersecurity projects and initiatives. Analyze end-to-end business processes of moderate to high complexity and information needs of the clients in one or more business functional areas. Communicate Cybersecurity processes to internal business clients. Comply with NERC, SOX and other standard process requirements.', '\xa0', 'Message Body:\xa0\xa0Please submit your strongest candidates following the qualifications, education, skills requirement and the template from HM ', '*LOCAL CANDIDATES ONLY*', 'Role – IT Business Analyst - Leader', 'Required industry experience: • 4 to 8 years as BA, preference for 5+ years in relevant industry, Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or Engineering or a job-related discipline, or equivalent experience Required technical experience • Strong experience with business IT applications Required functional experience • Experience with implementations, problem analysis and solutions for business applications. Required education and certifications • Technical Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience Additional requirements (Interpersonal Skills/Characteristics) • None', '• Business process design and documentation (Proficiency in Visio) • Requirements elicitation and communication • Product and solution testing/validation', 'send me your updated resume at amit.kumar@radiansys.com', 'Location – San Francisco, CA', '1) Strong communication skills – written and verbal', 'Responsibilities:', 'Contract – Contract on W2']

fast-changing environment that requires a high degree of multi-tasking and flexibility * Ambition, energy, and a desire to achieve and succeed * Flexibility to work and learn independently or with a WHO WE ARE: For over 20 years Metaformers has provided world class service to clients and offered team members a progressive environment and a diverse, energetic culture focused on knowledge leadership. We are a hybrid management consulting and cloud infrastructure and application solutions team. Our company is focused on helping organizations achieve people-driven ROI. As an organization, we consistently drive the evolution and adoption of new technologies, but one thing does not change, and that is our enduring commitment to our team members. From the individuals launching their careers through our Leadership Program to the experienced professionals who leverage decades of expertise - people are the essence of our company. For Metaformers civic engagement is not just an activity, it is in our DNA. So much so, we have developed a civic engagement app called CivicRush. Leveraging CivicRush, our team members are actively involved in transforming their local communities and those of our clients. We believe that our projects, whether for our clients or communities should be better for the footprints we leave behind. Metaformers recognizes that technology is a strategic transformation and modernization enabler, and our team members focus on our clients' unique challenges, specific needs, with a goal of maximizing their return on investment. We invite you to join a company comprised of passionate individuals who create success. Metaformers is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Metaformers does not discriminate in employment on the basis of race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy and gender identity), national origin, political affiliation, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, genetic information, age, membership in an employee organization, retaliation, parental status, military service, or other non-merit factor."]

job_text: ['', 'Qualifications', ' Partnering with teams to build and execute offering enhancement workplans, including driving collaboration with other internal teams', ' Bachelor’s degree in related discipline preferred (e.g., Finance/Accounting, Marketing, Economics, Engineering, Management/Business, Information Technology, MIS, etc.), or equivalent experience required', 'Together: ', ' Prior consulting experience is preferred', ' Maintaining and managing intranet pages that provide a portfolio view of the current client issues and strategic service offerings', ' Ready to get started? Join our team and make an impact. ', ' Bachelor’s degree in related discipline preferred (e.g., Finance/Accounting, Marketing, Economics, Engineering, Management/Business, Information Technology, MIS, etc.), or equivalent experience required 2-5 years of “hands on” Business Analyst experience Prior consulting experience is preferred Excellent interpersonal, written and oral communications and customer relations skills Experience interfacing effectively with all levels of management in a dynamic and rapidly evolving work environment Strong working knowledge of Microsoft Excel, Word, and PowerPoint Desired knowledge of Salesforce CRM, and PowerBI Ability to work permanently in the United States without sponsorship Travel requirements may include short, infrequent trips (<10%) ', 'We: ', ' Experience interfacing effectively with all levels of management in a dynamic and rapidly evolving work environment', 'The Business Analyst within our Issue and Offer Acceleration team will have the following responsibilities:', ' Strong working knowledge of Microsoft Excel, Word, and PowerPoint', ' Managing the client issue and offering portfolio change process, including end-to-end change management and ensuring all key systems are updated (i.e. CRM, Intranet, Website, etc.).', 'You: ', ' 2-5 years of “hands on” Business Analyst experience', 'Ready to thrive in the next step on your career journey?', ' Desired knowledge of Salesforce CRM, and PowerBI', 'West Monroe Partners is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer ', ' Preparing issue and offering data analysis and presentation materials for regular (quarterly) reviews with senior leadership', ' Collaborate and manage relationships across multiple internal teams as well as all consulting practices', ' Travel requirements may include short, infrequent trips (<10%) ', ' Excellent interpersonal, written and oral communications and customer relations skills', ' Ongoing data analysis of the firmwide client issue and offering portfolio, using sales and marketing data, to identify trends and provide key insights that drive decision making for investment or retirement of offerings', ' Ongoing data analysis of the firmwide client issue and offering portfolio, using sales and marketing data, to identify trends and provide key insights that drive decision making for investment or retirement of offerings Analysis of firmwide capabilities, using sales data, to provide insights on how capabilities are performing across all offerings and engagements as well as where opportunities exist to further promote capabilities and build new offerings in specific areas of the business Collaborate and manage relationships across multiple internal teams as well as all consulting practices Managing the client issue and offering portfolio change process, including end-to-end change management and ensuring all key systems are updated (i.e. CRM, Intranet, Website, etc.). Maintaining and managing intranet pages that provide a portfolio view of the current client issues and strategic service offerings Preparing issue and offering data analysis and presentation materials for regular (quarterly) reviews with senior leadership Creating and improving tools and templates to aid teams in the creation of new client issues and offerings Partnering with teams to build and execute offering enhancement workplans, including driving collaboration with other internal teams Creating presentations to communicate updates and status on key strategic projects for the issue and offering acceleration team Assisting or leading special projects on an ad-hoc basis Support firmwide education efforts around issues and offerings through training materials, communications and presentations.', ' Analysis of firmwide capabilities, using sales data, to provide insights on how capabilities are performing across all offerings and engagements as well as where opportunities exist to further promote capabilities and build new offerings in specific areas of the business', ' Assisting or leading special projects on an ad-hoc basis', ' Creating and improving tools and templates to aid teams in the creation of new client issues and offerings', ' Ability to work permanently in the United States without sponsorship', ' Support firmwide education efforts around issues and offerings through training materials, communications and presentations.', ' Creating presentations to communicate updates and status on key strategic projects for the issue and offering acceleration team', ' At West Monroe, our people are our business. ']

['', 'Your Tasks And Responsibilities', ' Ensure the development of programs and use of project standards for all analysis datasets, tables, listings and figures for assigned project with close cooperation with the study/project statistician; ', ' Bachelor of Science in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Natural Sciences, Informatics or related field or equivalent of theoretical/technical depth or Master of Science Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Natural Sciences, Informatics, or related field or equivalent (of theoretical/technical depth); ', ' Provide statistical programming and validation support for assigned clinical study/project; ', ' Lead and oversee all statistical programming function deliverables required for submissions (IND/NDA) to regulatory authorities for assigned projects/studies in compliance with CDISC standards; ', 'Location:', '  Provide statistical programming and validation support for assigned clinical study/project;   Contribute to study TLF and ADS specs;   Ensure the development of programs and use of project standards for all analysis datasets, tables, listings and figures for assigned project with close cooperation with the study/project statistician;   Lead and oversee all statistical programming function deliverables required for submissions (IND/NDA) to regulatory authorities for assigned projects/studies in compliance with CDISC standards;   Coordinate activities of assigned statistical programming team members;   Participate on global teams that evaluate processes and make suggestions for process and system needs and improvements;   Aid junior and external programmers in the development of statistical programs;   Work in close cooperation with other Clinical Operations departments;   Value added to the success of the company: What are the main objectives of the function;   Contribute to drug research, the development of new drugs, the approval of new drugs by health authorities and the surveillance of marketed drugs according to the major tasks and responsibilities of the position (cf. sec. 3).  ', ' Oncology experience. ', '  Bachelor of Science in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Natural Sciences, Informatics or related field or equivalent of theoretical/technical depth or Master of Science Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Natural Sciences, Informatics, or related field or equivalent (of theoretical/technical depth);   At least three years of experience in statistical programming or statistics in the pharmaceutical or biotechnology industry;   Have a thorough knowledge of Databases, CDISC standards and be well connected with the industry working groups;   Hands-on experience with software like R, Shiny, Spotfire or any other similar statistical interactive tool;   Project management or equivalent experience would be an asset;   Excellent demonstrated interpersonal, presentation and communication skills.  ', 'Who You Are', ' Participate on global teams that evaluate processes and make suggestions for process and system needs and improvements; ', 'Reference Code:', ' Have a thorough knowledge of Databases, CDISC standards and be well connected with the industry working groups; ', ' Project management or equivalent experience would be an asset; ', ' Excellent demonstrated interpersonal, presentation and communication skills. ', ' Work in close cooperation with other Clinical Operations departments; ', 'Bayer is a global enterprise with core competencies in the Life Science fields of health care and agriculture. Its products and services are designed to benefit people and improve their quality of life. At Bayer you have the opportunity to be part of a culture where we value the passion of our employees to innovate and give them the power to change.', '  Experience in SAS;   Oncology experience.  ', ' Hands-on experience with software like R, Shiny, Spotfire or any other similar statistical interactive tool; ', ' Aid junior and external programmers in the development of statistical programs; ', ' Contribute to drug research, the development of new drugs, the approval of new drugs by health authorities and the surveillance of marketed drugs according to the major tasks and responsibilities of the position (cf. sec. 3). ', ' Experience in SAS; ', ' At least three years of experience in statistical programming or statistics in the pharmaceutical or biotechnology industry; ', 'Email:', 'Lead Statistical Analyst', ' Value added to the success of the company: What are the main objectives of the function; ', 'Division:', ' Contribute to study TLF and ADS specs; ', ' YOUR APPLICATION ', 'Contact Us', ' Coordinate activities of assigned statistical programming team members; ']

["Evaluate DLP events, eliminate 'white noise' events (no action), and determine if a violation of corporate data policies has occurred", 'Eligibility', "Remote candidates will be consideredSummaryAdvisor Group is looking to add a Data Protection Analyst to our growing InfoSec team. Our selected candidate will assist with the monitoring of all Data Loss Prevention/Protection events, completing initial investigations, and escalating all necessary events to appropriate incident teams once determined as a true incident. The Analyst must be able to identify potential data leaks and determine if information constitutes a violation of any company policies related to Personal Identifiable Information (PII) or Intellectual Property (IP). The position supports the firm’s data protection program by documenting and analyzing existing data systems, data threats and vulnerabilities.Why Advisor Group?Competitive salary and annual bonus paid based on performanceGenerous time off package, including paid time off, paid holidays, and paid time to volunteer in the communityImmediate access to extensive benefits package that includes medical, dental and vision coverage, basic life insurance, long and short-term disability coverage and much more401(k) match from day one of employmentReferral bonuses if we hire your referred applicants to our open positionsAn enriching and engaging career in financial services – our employees overwhelmingly report that they find meaning and purpose in their day to day workExecutive leader access and interaction in all our locations due to flat structure, open office environments, town halls and speed mentoring eventsNew, professional, and collaborative working environment where parking is providedResponsibilitiesDocument enterprise data at rest and in-use, including data locations, physical and logical data flows.Analyze normal data usage patterns, including business process analysis, user behavior analysis, and user personas.Analyze existing data-loss threats and vulnerabilitiesAssist with the implementation of a framework for classifying sensitive data.Assist with the formulation, promulgation, and enforcement of data loss prevention policies, including data use, access control, data encryption and obfuscation policies.Assist with the selection, implementation, and usage of data loss prevention tools, including data classification and DLPParticipate in the ongoing monitoring of potential data loss.Support and participate in the security incident response team.Analyze potential data-loss breaches to determine their impact and root cause.All other duties as assignedEducation RequirementsBachelor’s degree in Information Technology or related field is preferred. Minimum of high school diploma or equivalent is required.Basic Requirements3+ years’ experience and hands on knowledge with Data Loss Prevention security controls and tools (e.g Symantec DLP, Splunk, Bluecoat, CASB, etc.)Industry certifications such as Security+, SSCP, GSEC, CISSP or relatedHands on experience with an incident management toolAbility to navigate and work effectively across a complex organization.Triage analyst experienceKnowledge of endpoint protection technology and loss protection strategies.Identify potential data leaks and determine if information constitutes a violation of any company policies related to Personal Identifiable Information (PII) or Intellectual Property (IP)Evaluate DLP events, eliminate 'white noise' events (no action), and determine if a violation of corporate data policies has occurredEscalates events according to the Data Loss Prevention triage workflow processIdentification of root cause in partnership with peer groups on remediation of control gaps/failurePreferred RequirementsKnowledge of, and experience with cloud-based information systems (e.g. Microsoft Azure/Office 365, Salesforce, SharePoint, Box)Experience performing, interpreting, and reporting vulnerability assessmentsKnowledge of computer networking and network-based information assurance devices Be A Part Of The Team Behind Our Success!At Advisor Group, we support more than 11,000 financial advisors, the people who help everyday Americans achieve their dreams. job_title: Insurance Data Analyst I or II
job_text: ['', 'Qualifications', 'Processes payment requests for funding programs and loss payments by obtaining and verifying approvals for payments and ensuring timely payments. Records cash receipts and payments for programs into control spreadsheets. Maintains controls and prepares reconciliations of cash for programs, updating general ledgers with coding and journal entries. Prepares intercompany cash settlements documents for programs and ensures that settlements are made and recorded properly.', 'May perform the duties of the Financial Database Coordinator under supervision of the Senior Finance Manager – FIS. Which includes but not limited to, coordinating with BH Systems and the Finance dept. to make updates in the Financial Database Systems, identifies potential program enhancements to existing applications or develops new applications, instructs programmers and Finance personnel about changes, and performs overall Financial Database balancing and control checks and determines overall Financial Database accuracy for the Finance Department to use. May prepare, balance, and determine overall completeness and correctness of the Page 14 databases quarterly.', 'Knowledge of financial reporting', 'Knowledge of statutory accounting principles', 'Compiles, reviews, analyzes and reconciles, and interprets financial and insurance information from various sources and prepares working papers, supplementary schedules for one or more companies or programs and summarizes program underwriting results. This may include statutory annual statements and/or separate financial statement packages and information for assigned companies or programs. Processes payment requests for funding programs and loss payments by obtaining and verifying approvals for payments and ensuring timely payments. Records cash receipts and payments for programs into control spreadsheets. Maintains controls and prepares reconciliations of cash for programs, updating general ledgers with coding and journal entries. Prepares intercompany cash settlements documents for programs and ensures that settlements are made and recorded properly.Coordinates communication of daily, monthly, and year end accounting, and financial statement and/or program information between Stamford, Connecticut, Boston, Massachusetts and/or other program operating locations and Omaha. Responsible for review, analysis, and inquiries with respect to this information, including development and completion of management reports. Answers questions and provides information as needed to management, auditors, examiners, actuary and accountants.May perform the duties of the Financial Database Coordinator under supervision of the Senior Finance Manager – FIS. Which includes but not limited to, coordinating with BH Systems and the Finance dept. to make updates in the Financial Database Systems, identifies potential program enhancements to existing applications or develops new applications, instructs programmers and Finance personnel about changes, and performs overall Financial Database balancing and control checks and determines overall Financial Database accuracy for the Finance Department to use. May prepare, balance, and determine overall completeness and correctness of the Page 14 databases quarterly.May calculate and prepare supplemental reserves, IBNR factors and mainframe reserving system information used for completing supplemental reserves and IBNR allocations, according to management guidelines and internal controls. Instructs programmers on changes to programs that build supplemental reserves and IBNR allocations.Assists in the development and maintenance of PC program applications using spreadsheet and/or database software to create processing systems and specific worksheets and databases used to meet various job duties. Assists in the development and maintenance of downloaded PC databases from mainframe computer systems as needed. May assist in development of mainframe computer systems for use with insurance company data and systems.May compile and analyze historical and current financial, statistical, and insurance information for Company management including special one-time projects. May complete special reports required by States or agencies by assessing and gathering data from appropriate source and compiling information to send to States or agencies. May assist in preparation of insurance information schedules, including premium , loss and reserve summaries, paid loss, reserve and incurred developments, and historic and current summaries of companies’ insurance data for review and use by company senior managers, BH Corporate, department managers, tax specialists, actuaries, examiners and IRS personnel for BH 10K reporting, management, tax, actuarial, audit and examination purposes.Maintains current working knowledge of related insurance accounting and financial reporting developments by researching (reading related materials) and discussing with others.Responds to inquiries from internal and external auditors regarding financial transactions, balances and procedures.Performs duties of and trains or assists Insurance Data Analyst I as needed.Performs special projects or related duties as assigned or as situation dictates.', 'Responds to inquiries from internal and external auditors regarding financial transactions, balances and procedures.', 'Preferred Knowledge', 'Knowledge of financial reportingKnowledge of statutory accounting principlesKnowledge of Microsoft Access', 'Performs duties of and trains or assists Insurance Data Analyst I as needed.', 'Assists in the development and maintenance of PC program applications using spreadsheet and/or database software to create processing systems and specific worksheets and databases used to meet various job duties. Assists in the development and maintenance of downloaded PC databases from mainframe computer systems as needed. May assist in development of mainframe computer systems for use with insurance company data and systems.', 'Personal computer, related software, and basic applications such as Excel and Word', 'Major Duties', 'Maintains current working knowledge of related insurance accounting and financial reporting developments by researching (reading related materials) and discussing with others.', 'May calculate and prepare supplemental reserves, IBNR factors and mainframe reserving system information used for completing supplemental reserves and IBNR allocations, according to management guidelines and internal controls. Instructs programmers on changes to programs that build supplemental reserves and IBNR allocations.', 'Life or property casualty insurance accounting experience', 'May compile and analyze historical and current financial, statistical, and insurance information for Company management including special one-time projects. May complete special reports required by States or agencies by assessing and gathering data from appropriate source and compiling information to send to States or agencies. May assist in preparation of insurance information schedules, including premium , loss and reserve summaries, paid loss, reserve and incurred developments, and historic and current summaries of companies’ insurance data for review and use by company senior managers, BH Corporate, department managers, tax specialists, actuaries, examiners and IRS personnel for BH 10K reporting, management, tax, actuarial, audit and examination purposes.', 'Coordinates communication of daily, monthly, and year end accounting, and financial statement and/or program information between Stamford, Connecticut, Boston, Massachusetts and/or other program operating locations and Omaha. Responsible for review, analysis, and inquiries with respect to this information, including development and completion of management reports. Answers questions and provides information as needed to management, auditors, examiners, actuary and accountants.', 'Performs special projects or related duties as assigned or as situation dictates.', 'Knowledge of general accounting principles', 'Knowledge of Microsoft Access', 'Bachelor degree in accounting or related field or equivalentKnowledge of general accounting principlesPersonal computer, related software, and basic applications such as Excel and WordLife or property casualty insurance accounting experience1-2 years related work experienceCompany and department practices and procedures', 'Compiles, reviews, analyzes and reconciles, and interprets financial and insurance information from various sources and prepares working papers, supplementary schedules for one or more companies or programs and summarizes program underwriting results. This may include statutory annual statements and/or separate financial statement packages and information for assigned companies or programs. ', 'Job Objective', 'Bachelor degree in accounting or related field or equivalent', 'Company', '1-2 years related work experience', 'Company and department practices and procedures', 'As a member of the Berkshire Hathaway group of insurance companies, we offer outstanding opportunities for professionals interested in working with a successful company. We offer unparalleled financial strength, stability and “large company” benefits, in addition to an exciting, friendly, “small company” atmosphere.', 'A comprehensive benefits package is available for regular, full-time employees, including health, vision, dental, life and disability insurance as well as a 401(k) with company match. We also proudly offer 100% upfront tuition reimbursement to regular, full-time employees, to further your education. Our Omaha office boasts a complimentary state-of-the-art, on-site gym, a robust wellness program, low-cost downtown parking, and numerous volunteer and networking opportunities with other emerging professionals.']

Recent Cloud platform experience (AWS/Snowflake)', 'Our client is looking for a Business Analyst who can support their current project that is revolved around Infrastructure upgrades, application migration and Cloud platform. They have 2 vendors performing the technical implementations, however, there are some challenges and roadblocks that this consultant will be expected to work through in order for the customer to understand their current and to-be environment states. Someone with strong advisory and communication skills is a must. They should have deep technical skills to ensure business objectives are being met on the system and application side.', 'The candidate must have:', '2.\xa0Strong IT systems analysis (Infrastructure/Cloud)', '7. Ability to create order our of chaos', '6.\xa0Government experience', '5. Consultative/Advisory skills', 'This resource is not going to be responsible for the technical requirements, as those have been established, they will be analyzing the current requirements, the deliverables that have been met and identify gaps.', '4.\xa0Ability to analyze business problems and develop technical solutions', 'We have a 6+ month contract position for a Business Analyst located in Sacramento. The work is 50/50 on-site and remote. A local candidate is preferred.']

job_title: Healthcare Analytics Business Analyst - Murray, Utah or Remote
job_text: ['', 'Qualifications', ' Exceptional presentation and communication skills, both verbal and written.', ' Create and deliver custom reports/dashboards and handle special projects as needed.', ' Gain access to necessary data though SQL queries, excel extracts, and various tools.', ' Highly organized, detail-oriented, and excellent internal and external customer service skills.', ' Requires strong interpersonal skills with the ability to work with both management and other employees; exercise good judgement in choosing appropriate communication channels.', ' Interpret the data to provide meaningful answers or recommendations.', ' Prefer experience with QlikView, Qlik Sense, Power BI and other BI tools.', ' Validate data is queried and reported in a manner that drives efficiency and reduces errors.', " Professional experience in 340B, pharmacy, healthcare, or related. Bachelor's Degree in Healthcare Administration, Research/Statistics or related field required or a Master's Degree in Business Intelligence. A combination of education and experience may meet requirements. Experience developing analyses using SQL or SAS required. Experience working with and manipulating large sets of data. Excellent analytical, organizational, and data driven skills required. Proficient with data mining, interpretation, and explanation. Ability to juggle multiple projects and shifting priorities. Ability to organize and prioritize multiple projects, determine the best course of action, identify resources needed to complete a project, obtain valid data, and create clear and understandable reports that answer the questions being asked or solve the problems at hand. Highly organized, detail-oriented, and excellent internal and external customer service skills. Exceptional presentation and communication skills, both verbal and written. Requires strong interpersonal skills with the ability to work with both management and other employees; exercise good judgement in choosing appropriate communication channels. Proven track record as a team player with strong business ethics. Proficient use of MS Excel, Access, Word, PowerPoint and SQL. Prefer experience with QlikView, Qlik Sense, Power BI and other BI tools.", ' Professional experience in 340B, pharmacy, healthcare, or related.', " Gather and analyze business requirements and goals from various stakeholders. Gain access to necessary data though SQL queries, excel extracts, and various tools. Interpret the data to provide meaningful answers or recommendations. Identify patterns and trends in the data; ability to forecast; ability to tell the data's story. Create and deliver custom reports/dashboards and handle special projects as needed. Perform advanced analytical activities, including defining, measuring, and communicating core operational metrics and providing insight to the business. Perform both routine and ad hoc reports and analyses. Validate data is queried and reported in a manner that drives efficiency and reduces errors. Schedule project timelines and coordinate projects through initial idea to completion. May coordinate and prioritize the work of others. Perform other duties as assigned.", ' Schedule project timelines and coordinate projects through initial idea to completion.', ' Perform both routine and ad hoc reports and analyses.', ' Ability to juggle multiple projects and shifting priorities.', ' Experience developing analyses using SQL or SAS required.', ' May coordinate and prioritize the work of others.', ' Ability to organize and prioritize multiple projects, determine the best course of action, identify resources needed to complete a project, obtain valid data, and create clear and understandable reports that answer the questions being asked or solve the problems at hand.', ' Perform other duties as assigned.', ' Gather and analyze business requirements and goals from various stakeholders.', ' Proficient with data mining, interpretation, and explanation.', ' Experience working with and manipulating large sets of data.', ' Excellent analytical, organizational, and data driven skills required.', " Bachelor's Degree in Healthcare Administration, Research/Statistics or related field required or a Master's Degree in Business Intelligence.", ' Proficient use of MS Excel, Access, Word, PowerPoint and SQL.', 'Responsibilities', ' Proven track record as a team player with strong business ethics.', " Identify patterns and trends in the data; ability to forecast; ability to tell the data's story.", ' Perform advanced analytical activities, including defining, measuring, and communicating core operational metrics and providing insight to the business.', ' A combination of education and experience may meet requirements.']

Ability to commit to a 05% travel component.', ' Engage: Seek out and share information to make sure everyone is fully informed and aware of what they need to know to succeed.', ' Performs back up support to resolve system & process issues with Sxe, Radio Frequency systems and Digital Shipper.', ' Ability to write clearly and effectively present ideas, decisions, or actions.']

['', 'Project Description', " Under the guidance of the Client's senior analysts, define and execute data analysis plan for large scale multivariate datasets to support disease stratification and precision medicine. Perform analysis of Next Generation Sequencing (e.g., RNA-seq, Exome and Whole Genome Sequencing) and derive clinically and biologically meaningful interpretations. Implement quality controls and benchmarking applied to novel NGS workflows to deliver high quality production tools. Summarize analysis results and write analysis report. Evaluate and adapt latest scientific findings and methods into bioinformatics analysis plans.", 'Evaluate and adapt latest scientific findings and methods into bioinformatics analysis plans.', 'Familiarity with cloud computing environments (RCE, Docker, AWS) is highly desired.', 'Deep understanding of disease biology in oncology is a strong plus.', 'Summarize analysis results and write analysis report.', 'Required Skills', 'Experiences working with Next Generation Sequencing datasets, including Whole-Genome, Whole-Exome Sequencing and RNA-seq, is required.', 'Ability to work both independently and collaboratively, and to handle several concurrent, fast-paced projects while conforming with rigorous requirements of clinical studies.', 'Ph.D. or M.S. with 3+ years of experience in computational biology, bioinformatics, statistics or related fields. Experiences in biotech or pharmaceutical industries is a plus.', 'Excellent communication, data presentation, and visualization skills.', ' Ph.D. or M.S. with 3+ years of experience in computational biology, bioinformatics, statistics or related fields. Experiences in biotech or pharmaceutical industries is a plus. Strong experience using R for complex data analysis is required. Experiences with other high-level programming language such as Python is a plus. Experiences with reproducible research practices, including GitHub, is required. Experiences working with Next Generation Sequencing datasets, including Whole-Genome, Whole-Exome Sequencing and RNA-seq, is required. Familiarity with cloud computing environments (RCE, Docker, AWS) is highly desired. Expertise in application of modern machine-learning/AI approaches is a plus. Deep understanding of disease biology in oncology is a strong plus. Ability to work both independently and collaboratively, and to handle several concurrent, fast-paced projects while conforming with rigorous requirements of clinical studies. Strong problem-solving and collaboration skills, and rigorous and creative thinking. Excellent communication, data presentation, and visualization skills. ', 'Expertise in application of modern machine-learning/AI approaches is a plus.', 'Perform analysis of Next Generation Sequencing (e.g., RNA-seq, Exome and Whole Genome Sequencing) and derive clinically and biologically meaningful interpretations.', 'NGS DATA ANALYST', 'SUMMIT, NJ ', 'Strong problem-solving and collaboration skills, and rigorous and creative thinking.', 'Job Description', 'Experiences with reproducible research practices, including GitHub, is required.', "Under the guidance of the Client's senior analysts, define and execute data analysis plan for large scale multivariate datasets to support disease stratification and precision medicine.", 'Strong experience using R for complex data analysis is required. Experiences with other high-level programming language such as Python is a plus.', 'Implement quality controls and benchmarking applied to novel NGS workflows to deliver high quality production tools.']

Needs to have a good understanding of how to develop and build SQL queries in order to collect, analyze and report on the most useful information. Needs to have experience integrating architecture requirements through Business Enterprise Architecture artifacts (both business and technical artifacts)  Business data analysis includes the activities to help managers make strategic decisions, achieve major goals and solve complex problems, by collecting, analyzing and reporting the most useful information relevant to managers' needs. Information could be about the causes of the current situation, the most likely trends to occur, and what should be done as a result.  Activities can include business analytics activities such as identifying and verifying potential strategies and solutions, and testing the feasibility of the most favored solutions. Analysis is based, as much as possible, on relevant, accurate and reliable information, often involving interactive and automated statistical analysis -- or data analysis. Must be able to elicit requirements, write and maintain requirements. Must be able to write/manage user stories and have experience in providing systems solution analysis against defined requirements. ['', '• Serve as technical BI consultant to non-technical stakeholders.', '• Help drive our data-driven culture: accumulate, analyze, present, and leverage data in decision making, and look for opportunities to cultivate richer insights about our products', '• Bachelor of Science Degree in a related business or technical field', '• Knowledge of software development, user experience', '• Extensive experience with Office software suite - Excel, Word, Outlook, PowerPoint, Visio, Teams, and collaborative working in Microsoft Office.', 'Requirements/ Skills', '• Collaborate with other Product Owners to determine product roadmap', '• Generate JIRA tickets with product requirements and present / refine the tickets with Business Intelligence team.', '• Team player and highly collaborative', '• Willingness to learn new technologies, innate curiosity, and an ability to question the status quo', '• Proactively communicate product roadmap, implementation plans and challenges with impacted stakeholders, both external and internal.', '• Act as “bridge” between BI development team and business stakeholders.', '• 2+ years of related business experience in Product Management, Business Analytics, or Business Intelligence.', '• Strong technical foundation. Prefer experience with BI technologies such as SQL Server, Analysis Services, Power BI, SQL Server Reporting Services', 'In this role, you will work with the Data Analytics Product Owner to drive the creation of internal and external facing data products. You will engage with business area owners and subject matter experts across all aspects of the business to identify problems and inefficiencies that can be solved with data. At times, you will serve as a consultant to non-technical stakeholders to understand challenges and provide recommendations. You will do data analysis to elevate your understanding of business processes. You will work directly with the Business Intelligence development team to explain business processes, communicate challenges, and create requirements to ultimately delivery sustainable and scalable data products. ', '• Experience in product management, project management and/or the implementation of IT strategies.', '• Experience in insurance is a plus', '• Engage internal and external customers to understand their needs and gather data product requirements', '• Strong business analysis skills with ability to understand business processes and identify core performance metrics, identify problems, and areas of opportunity.', '• Exceptional communication skills', '• Ability to maintain focus on delivering value to the customer', 'Responsibilities:', '• Outstanding data analysis and data-driven decision-making skills.']

['', 'KIK is an Equal Employment Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer. KIK does not discriminate against qualified applicants or employees on the basis of race, color, age, religion, sex, pregnancy, national origin, ancestry, age, physical or mental disability, veteran status, status in uniformed services, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, martial status, genetic information or any other status protected by law.', 'We are KIK!', 'Demonstrable Microsoft Excel skills in converting large amounts of data into actionable insights.', '2- or 4-year college degree in Business, Finance, Computer Science, or similar discipline.', '6+ years with a retailer or CPG supplier sales team in analytical roles.', 'Develop and prepare weekly reports that include key performance indicators and create presentations that recommend sales, supply chain, and category actions to increase sales.', '2- or 4-year college degree in Business, Finance, Computer Science, or similar discipline.6+ years with a retailer or CPG supplier sales team in analytical roles.Demonstrable Microsoft Excel skills in converting large amounts of data into actionable insights.Excellent communications, verbal and written.Proven record of collaboration and teamwork in achieving business goals.', 'Microsoft Excel, Retail Link, IRI and Nielsen syndicated data, and ProSpace', 'KIK is also committed to providing reasonable accommodations for applicants and employees with protected disabilities to the extent required by applicable laws.', 'Assemble and analyze customer data from various sources, deriving clear and compelling insights that promote business growth.Develop and prepare weekly reports that include key performance indicators and create presentations that recommend sales, supply chain, and category actions to increase sales.Collaborate with cross-functional business partners within the company and the customer to meet performance objectives. Provide sales information to counterparts in company headquarters to support project management and demand planning efforts.\xa0Develop analytical tools that guide decisions made by the customer’s buyers, planners, and replenishment managersUtilize various software applications, including Microsoft Excel, Retail Link, IRI and Nielsen syndicated data, and ProSpace to support actions that optimize promotion sell-through, product pricing, sales and inventory metrics, product assortment, and shelf placement.\xa0', 'Utilize various software applications, including Microsoft Excel, Retail Link, IRI and Nielsen syndicated data, and ProSpace to support actions that optimize promotion sell-through, product pricing, sales and inventory metrics, product assortment, and shelf placement.\xa0', 'We create the products and brands that people trust to clean, sanitize, and protect their homes, pools and cars.\xa0We are one of North America’s largest independent consumer product manufacturers with 20 North American manufacturing facilities.\xa0We also operate globally in Europe, Asia, UK, Australia, New Zealand and South Africa.\xa0We are known by our portfolio of over 40 brands including Spic and Span® and\xa0Comet® cleaning products, Clorox® Pool&Spa™ (under license), BioGuard®, and Natural Chemistry® pool chemicals, and Prestone® and Holts® automotive performance chemicals.\xa0We are also the #1 producer in North America for store-brand (“private label”) bleach and a leading private label provider of laundry detergent and additives, dishwashing products, general purpose cleaning and other home care products.\xa0', "KIK offers very competitive salary and comprehensive benefits including health, wellness, dental, vision, life, and disability insurance. You can plan for your future with KIK's retirement savings options including employer match. KIK also recognizes the importance of continuing education and offers Education Assistance to our employees to encourage continued personal development and growth.", 'Qualifications:', 'Our global team of over 2,500 employees drive our capabilities in product development, product formulation, strategic sourcing, manufacturing, packaging design, brand marketing, project management, quality assurance, compliance, distribution and logistics.', 'Excellent communications, verbal and written.', 'Essential Job Functions:', 'Assemble and analyze customer data from various sources, deriving clear and compelling insights that promote business growth.', 'Thank you for your interest and consideration of a position with KIK Custom Products.', 'Proven record of collaboration and teamwork in achieving business goals.', 'Our organization is constantly evolving and is driven by a set of “One KIK” values – a dedication to following through on commitments in a customer-focused, profit-motivated way; while never compromising on safety, ethics or integrity.\xa0\xa0', 'Collaborate with cross-functional business partners within the company and the customer to meet performance objectives. Provide sales information to counterparts in company headquarters to support project management and demand planning efforts.\xa0Develop analytical tools that guide decisions made by the customer’s buyers, planners, and replenishment managers', '\xa0', 'A\xa0Career with KIK Offers:']
